content: Singaporean parliamentary meeting The **5th Parliament of Singapore** was a meeting of the [Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore). It commenced its first and only session on 3 February 1981 and was dissolved on 4 December 1984. The members of the 5th Parliament were elected in the [1980 general election](/wiki/1980_Singaporean_general_election). Parliament was controlled by a [People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) majority, led by [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister) [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) and his [Cabinet](/wiki/Cabinet_of_Singapore). The Speaker was Dr [Yeoh Ghim Seng](/wiki/Yeoh_Ghim_Seng). Two seats were vacated during the term: on 14 October 1981, [Anson](/wiki/Anson_Single_Member_Constituency)'s MP [Devan Nair](/wiki/Devan_Nair) vacated his seat to assume his [presidency](/wiki/President_of_Singapore), resulting in the first-ever presence of any opposition-elect with [Workers' Party](/wiki/Workers%27_Party) MP [J. B. Jeyaretnam](/wiki/J._B._Jeyaretnam) winning the ensuing [by-election](/wiki/1981_Anson_by-election). Exactly two years later on 14 October 1983, [Havelock](/wiki/Havelock_Single_Member_Constituency)'s MP [Hon Sui Sen](/wiki/Hon_Sui_Sen) died during the term, but a by-election was not called unlike Anson's case and thus allowing the seat to become vacant until the end of term. ## Officeholders - [**Speaker**](/wiki/Speaker_of_the_Parliament_of_Singapore)**:** [Yeoh Ghim Seng](/wiki/Yeoh_Ghim_Seng) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)) - **[Deputy Speaker](/wiki/Speaker_of_the_Parliament_of_Singapore#List_of_deputy_speakers):** [Hwang Soo Jin](/wiki/Hwang_Soo_Jin) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)) - **[Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore):** [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)) - [**Deputy Prime Minister**](/wiki/Deputy_Prime_Minister_of_Singapore)**:** - [Goh Keng Swee](/wiki/Goh_Keng_Swee) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)) - [S. Rajaratnam](/wiki/S._Rajaratnam) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)) - [**Leader of the House**](/wiki/Leader_of_the_House_(Singapore))**:** [E. W. Barker](/wiki/E._W._Barker) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)) - [**Leader of the Opposition**](/wiki/Leader_of_the_Opposition_(Singapore))**:** [J. B. Jeyaretnam](/wiki/J._B._Jeyaretnam) ([WP](/wiki/Workers%27_Party_(Singapore))), from 31 October 1981 - **[Party Whip of the People's Action Party](/wiki/Party_Whip_of_the_People%27s_Action_Party):** Lee Yiok Seng ## Composition PartyMembersAt [election](/wiki/1980_Singaporean_general_election)At dissolution[People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)75**73**[Workers' Party](/wiki/Workers%27_Party_(Singapore))0**1**Vacant seats0**1****Total**75**75****Government majority**75**72** ## Members This is the list of members of the 5th Parliament of Singapore elected in the 1980 general election.
